required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Observational Registry of NovoSeven® Used as On-demand Treatment of Bleeds in Patients With Haemophilia A and B With Inhibitors
clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective Observational Registry on the Use of NovoSeven® (Activated Recombinant Human Factor VIIa) for on Demand Treatment of Mild to Moderate Bleeds in Haemophilia A and B Patients With Inhibitors

brief_summary.textblock: This study was conducted in Africa, Europe, the Middle-East and South America. The primary objective of this registry was to observe the use of single dose and multi-dose use of activated recombinant human factor VII and to compare short-term outcomes, including effectiveness, safety, quality of life and treatment satisfaction with the approved treatments.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Bleed Treatments Resulting in Effective Bleed Resolution (All Bleed Episodes)
primary_outcome.description: The percentage of bleed treatments successfully resulting in bleed resolution. Analysis only considers the patient's opinion of effectiveness at 9 hours, with a rating of "Effective" considered as successful treatment.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Bleed Treatments Resulting in Effective Bleed Resolution (Spontaneous Bleed Episodes)
primary_outcome.description: The percentage of bleed treatments successfully resulting in bleed resolution. Analysis only considers the patient's opinion of effectiveness at 9 hours, with a rating of "Effective" considered as successful treatment.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Bleed Treatments Resulting in Effective Pain Relief (All Bleed Episodes)
primary_outcome.description: The percentage of participants with effective pain relief. Pain relief was a subjective assessment made by the patient during treatment of a bleed episode.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Bleed Treatments Resulting in Effective Pain Relief (Spontaneous Bleed Episodes)
primary_outcome.description: The percentage of participants with effective pain relief. Pain relief was a subjective assessment made by the patient during treatment of a bleed episode.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Bleed Treatments Resulting in Effective Haemostasis (Cessation of Bleeds) by Time Point (All Bleed Episodes)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 hour, 3 hours and 6 hours, respectively, after first injection
secondary_outcome.description: Effective haemostasis at 3 different time points for all bleeds. Patient reported outcomes are reported over 1 hour, 3 hours and 6 hours.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Bleed Treatments Resulting in Effective Haemostasis (Cessation of Bleeds) by Time Point (Spontaneous Bleed Episodes)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 hour, 3 hours and 6 hours, respectively, after first injection
secondary_outcome.description: Effective haemostasis at 3 different time points for all bleeds. Patient reported outcomes are reported over 1 hour, 3 hours and 6 hours.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Bleed Treatments Resulting in Effective Pain Relief by Time Point (All Bleed Episodes)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 hour, 3 hours and 6 hours, respectively, after first injection
secondary_outcome.description: Effective pain relief at 3 different time points for all bleeds. Patient reported outcomes are reported over 1 hour, 3 hours and 6 hours.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Bleed Treatments Resulting in Effective Pain Relief by Time Point (Spontaneous Bleed Episodes)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 hour, 3 hours and 6 hours, respectively, after first injection
secondary_outcome.description: Effective pain relief at 3 different time points for spontaneous bleeds. Patient reported outcomes are reported over 1 hour, 3 hours and 6 hours.

secondary_outcome.measure: Total Number of Injections (All Bleed Episodes)
secondary_outcome.description: The median number of injections required to treat individual bleed episodes.

secondary_outcome.measure: Total Number of Injections (Spontaneous Bleed Episodes)
secondary_outcome.description: The median number of injections required to treat individual bleed episodes.

secondary_outcome.measure: Total Exposure (Cumulative Dose) to Activated Recombinant Human Factor VII (All Bleed Episodes)
secondary_outcome.description: The median total cumulative dose required to treat individual bleed episodes.

secondary_outcome.measure: Total Exposure (Cumulative Dose) to Activated Recombinant Human Factor VII (Spontaneous Bleed Episodes)
secondary_outcome.description: The median total cumulative dose required to treat individual bleed episodes.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Patients Reporting Satisfaction With Symptom Relief (All Bleed Episodes)
secondary_outcome.description: Patient rate of satisfaction with symptom relief for the bleed episode overall on a 7-point Likert scale. Completion of questionnaire was voluntary. A Likert scale is an ordered, multiple choice questionnaire from which respondents choose one option that best aligns with their view of the particular outcome being measured. Scale answers ranged from extremely satisfied to extremely dissatisfied. The percentage of bleed episodes for which patients reported "extremely satisfied", "very satisfied" or "satisfied" is presented.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Bleed Treatments Resulting in Patient Satisfaction With Symptom Relief (Spontaneous Bleed Episodes)
secondary_outcome.description: Patient rate of satisfaction with symptom relief for the bleed episode overall on a 7-point Likert scale. Completion of questionnaire was voluntary. A Likert scale is an ordered, multiple choice questionnaire from which respondents choose one option that best aligns with their view of the particular outcome being measured. Scale answers ranged from extremely satisfied to extremely dissatisfied. The percentage of bleed episodes for which patients reported "extremely satisfied", "very satisfied" or "satisfied" is presented.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Bleed Treatments Resulting in Patient Satisfaction With Ease of Use (All Bleed Episodes)
secondary_outcome.description: Rate of ease of use related to activated recombinant human factor VII on a 7-point Likert scale. Completion of questionnaire was voluntary. A Likert scale is an ordered, multiple choice questionnaire from which respondents choose one option that best aligns with their view of the particular outcome being measured. Scale answers ranged from extremely difficult to extremely easy. The percentage of bleed episodes for which patients reported "extremely easy", "very easy" or "easy" is presented.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Bleed Treatments Resulting in Patient Satisfaction With Ease of Use (Spontaneous Bleed Episodes)
secondary_outcome.description: Rate of ease of use related to activated recombinant human factor VII on a 7-point Likert scale. Completion of questionnaire was voluntary. A Likert scale is an ordered, multiple choice questionnaire from which respondents choose one option that best aligns with their view of the particular outcome being measured. Scale answers ranged from extremely difficult to extremely easy. The percentage of bleed episodes for which patients reported "extremely easy", "very easy" or "easy" is presented.

secondary_outcome.measure: Overall Time to Cessation of Bleed/Achievement of Haemostasis (All Bleed Episodes)
secondary_outcome.description: Median time to achievement of haemostasis/bleed cessation calculated using Kaplan Meier life table methods. If approximately 50% or less of bleeds achieved the endpoint in a given initial dose subgroup, the median cannot be calculated and it is reported as not applicable

secondary_outcome.measure: Overall Time to Cessation of Bleed/Achievement of Haemostasis (Spontaneous Bleed Episodes)
secondary_outcome.description: Median time to achievement of haemostasis/bleed cessation calculated using Kaplan Meier life table methods. If approximately 50% or less of bleeds achieved the endpoint in a given initial dose subgroup, the median cannot be calculated and it is reported as not applicable

secondary_outcome.measure: Overall Time to Cessation/Achievement of Haemostasis (Spontaneous Bleed Episodes)
secondary_outcome.description: Median time to achievement of haemostasis/bleed cessation calculated using Kaplan Meier life table methods. If approximately 50% or less of bleeds achieved the endpoint in a given initial dose subgroup, the median cannot be calculated and it is reported as not applicable.

secondary_outcome.measure: Childrens' Health Related Quality of Life (Haemo-QoL): Overall Score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (week 0) and and registry discontinuation (up to 28 months)
secondary_outcome.description: The Haemo-QoL is a specific multidimensional validated and reliable questionnaire used to assess quality of life in patients with haemophilia. Scores are reported on a 0 to 100 scale—higher scores indicate more impairment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Adults' Health Related Quality of Life (Haemo-QoL-A): Overall Score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (week 0) and and registry discontinuation (up to 28 months)
secondary_outcome.description: The adult Haemo-QoL-A is a specific multidimensional validated and reliable questionnaire used to assess quality of life in patients with haemophilia. Scores are reported on a 0 to 100 scale—higher scores indicate more impairment.

other_outcome.measure: Percentage of Bleed Treatments Resulting in Effective Haemostasis (Cessation of Bleed) by Dose Level (All Bleed Episodes)
other_outcome.description: Percentage of bleeds with effective haemostasis within 9 hours of first injection of activated recombinant human factor VII. Patient reported assessments were sorted into 3 sub-categories: "effective" = bleed resolved or substantially improved; "partially effective" = bleed with some improvement; "ineffective" = bleed with no change or with worsening.

other_outcome.measure: Percentage of Bleed Treatments Resulting in Effective Haemostasis (Cessation of Bleed) by Dose Level (Spontaneous Bleed Episodes)
other_outcome.description: Percentage of bleeds with effective haemostasis within 9 hours of first injection of activated recombinant human factor VII. Patient reported assessments were sorted into 3 sub-categories: "effective" = bleed resolved or substantially improved; "partially effective" = bleed with some improvement; "ineffective" = bleed with no change or with worsening.

other_outcome.measure: Percentage of Bleed Treatments Resulting in Effective Pain Relief by Initial Dose (All Bleed Episodes)
other_outcome.description: Percentage of bleeds with effective pain relief within 9 hours of first injection of activated recombinant human factor VII. Patient reported assessments were sorted into 3 sub-categories: "Better" = pain resolved or decreased substantially; "Same" = no change; "Worsened" = pain worsening.

other_outcome.measure: Percentage of Bleed Treatments Resulting in Effective Pain Relief by Initial Dose (Spontaneous Bleed Episodes)
other_outcome.description: Percentage of bleeds with effective pain relief within 9 hours of first injection of activated recombinant human factor VII. Patient reported assessments were sorted into 3 sub-categories: "Better" = pain resolved or decreased substantially; "Same" = no change; "Worsened" = pain worsening.

arm_group.description: Male patients above 2 years of age with haemophilia A or B who have developed inhibitors and have been prescribed on-demand treatment of activated recombinant human factor VII at any dose for treatment of mild to moderate spontaneous bleeds

intervention.description: Treatment of patients experiencing bleeds at the discretion of the physician/caregiver

study_pop.textblock: Patients with haemophilia A or B with inhibitors, using activated recombinant human factor VII as on-demand treatment

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosed with haemophilia A or B with inhibitors
- Experience mild to moderate spontaneous bleeds which require on-demand treatment and who are currently prescribed activated recombinant human factor VII
- Be able and willing to provide informed consent (or proxy consent by caregiver, if applicable), as required by local research ethics committee, governmental or regulatory authorities
- Be willing to provide information on at least one alternate contact person in the event that the patient be somehow lost-to-follow-up over the course of registry participation (not applicable if patient is withdrawn)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Known hypersensitivity to the active substance or the excipients in the formulation of activated recombinant human factor VII, or to mouse, hamster or bovine protein

group.description: Male patients above 2 years of age with haemophilia A or B who have developed inhibitors and have been prescribed on-demand treatment of activated recombinant human factor VII at any dose for treatment of mild to moderate spontaneous bleeds

Gender

Outcome of immune tolerance induction (ITI) treatment

measure.title: Total Number of Injections (Spontaneous Bleed Episodes)
measure.description: The median number of injections required to treat individual bleed episodes.
measure.population: Analysis set is spontaneous bleed episodes treated with any initial dose

outcome.title: Total Exposure (Cumulative Dose) to Activated Recombinant Human Factor VII (All Bleed Episodes)
outcome.description: The median total cumulative dose required to treat individual bleed episodes.
outcome.population: Analysis set is all bleed episodes, regardless of bleed type or initial dose level. Excludes bleeds episodes with greater than 24 hours between 1st and 2nd rFVII dose where total cumulative dose recorded likely reflects treatment of re-bleeding or prophylactic/maintenance dosing

group.title: Activated Recombinant Human Factor VII
group.description: Male patients above 2 years of age with haemophilia A or B who have developed inhibitors and have been prescribed on-demand treatment of activated recombinant human factor VII at any dose for treatment of mild to moderate spontaneous bleeds

measure.title: Total Exposure (Cumulative Dose) to Activated Recombinant Human Factor VII (All Bleed Episodes)
measure.description: The median total cumulative dose required to treat individual bleed episodes.
measure.population: Analysis set is all bleed episodes, regardless of bleed type or initial dose level. Excludes bleeds episodes with greater than 24 hours between 1st and 2nd rFVII dose where total cumulative dose recorded likely reflects treatment of re-bleeding or prophylactic/maintenance dosing

outcome.title: Total Exposure (Cumulative Dose) to Activated Recombinant Human Factor VII (Spontaneous Bleed Episodes)
outcome.description: The median total cumulative dose required to treat individual bleed episodes.
outcome.population: Analysis set is spontaneous bleed episodes. Excludes bleeds episodes with > 24 hours between 1st and 2nd rFVII dose where total cumulative dose recorded likely reflects treatment of re-bleeding or prophylactic/maintenance dosing, and 2 bleed episodes categorised as CNS that would not meet criteria of mild to moderate spontaneous bleed episodes

group.title: Activated Recombinant Human Factor VII

outcome.title: Percentage of Patients Reporting Satisfaction With Symptom Relief (All Bleed Episodes)
outcome.description: Patient rate of satisfaction with symptom relief for the bleed episode overall on a 7-point Likert scale. Completion of questionnaire was voluntary. A Likert scale is an ordered, multiple choice questionnaire from which respondents choose one option that best aligns with their view of the particular outcome being measured. Scale answers ranged from extremely satisfied to extremely dissatisfied. The percentage of bleed episodes for which patients reported "extremely satisfied", "very satisfied" or "satisfied" is presented.
outcome.population: Analysis set is all bleed episodes, regardless of bleed type or initial dose level

measurement_list.measurement: Using Kaplan-Meier methods to calculate the median time to event takes into account the censoring of data at the upper part of the distribution. If the upper limit falls to the right of the censoring time, then it will be missing
Since 50% or less of bleeds achieved the endpoint in the intermediate dose subgroup, the median cannot be calculated and it is reported as "not applicable" (NA)

Using Kaplan-Meier methods to calculate the median time to event takes into account the censoring of data at the upper part of the distribution. If the upper limit falls to the right of the censoring time, then it will be missing

outcome.title: Overall Time to Cessation of Bleed/Achievement of Haemostasis (Spontaneous Bleed Episodes)
outcome.description: Median time to achievement of haemostasis/bleed cessation calculated using Kaplan Meier life table methods. If approximately 50% or less of bleeds achieved the endpoint in a given initial dose subgroup, the median cannot be calculated and it is reported as not applicable
outcome.population: Analysis set is spontaneous bleed episodes treated with any initial dose

group.title: Activated Recombinant Human Factor VII
group.description: Male patients above 2 years of age with haemophilia A or B who have developed inhibitors and have been prescribed on-demand treatment of activated recombinant human factor VII at any dose for treatment of mild to moderate spontaneous bleeds

measure.title: Overall Time to Cessation of Bleed/Achievement of Haemostasis (Spontaneous Bleed Episodes)
measure.description: Median time to achievement of haemostasis/bleed cessation calculated using Kaplan Meier life table methods. If approximately 50% or less of bleeds achieved the endpoint in a given initial dose subgroup, the median cannot be calculated and it is reported as not applicable
measure.population: Analysis set is spontaneous bleed episodes treated with any initial dose

measurement_list.measurement: Using Kaplan-Meier methods to calculate the median time to event takes into account the censoring of data at the upper part of the distribution. If the upper limit falls to the right of the censoring time, then it will be missing

Using Kaplan-Meier methods to calculate the median time to event takes into account the censoring of data at the upper part of the distribution. If the upper limit falls to the right of the censoring time, then it will be missing
Since 50% or less of bleeds achieved the endpoint in the intermediate dose subgroup, the median cannot be calculated and it is reported as "not applicable" (NA)

Using Kaplan-Meier methods to calculate the median time to event takes into account the censoring of data at the upper part of the distribution. If the upper limit falls to the right of the censoring time, then it will be missing

outcome.title: Overall Time to Cessation/Achievement of Haemostasis (Spontaneous Bleed Episodes)
outcome.description: Median time to achievement of haemostasis/bleed cessation calculated using Kaplan Meier life table methods. If approximately 50% or less of bleeds achieved the endpoint in a given initial dose subgroup, the median cannot be calculated and it is reported as not applicable.
outcome.population: Analysis set is spontaneous bleed episodes treated with any initial dose, excluding bleed episodes treated with more than one dose for which > 24 hours between the 1st and 2nd dose was reported (bleed episodes with > 24 hours between 1st and 2nd rFVIIa dose likely reflects treatment of re-bleeding or prophylactic/maintenance dosing)

group.title: Activated Recombinant Human Factor VII
group.description: Male patients above 2 years of age with haemophilia A or B who have developed inhibitors and have been prescribed on-demand treatment of activated recombinant human factor VII at any dose for treatment of mild to moderate spontaneous bleeds

measure.title: Overall Time to Cessation/Achievement of Haemostasis (Spontaneous Bleed Episodes)
measure.description: Median time to achievement of haemostasis/bleed cessation calculated using Kaplan Meier life table methods. If approximately 50% or less of bleeds achieved the endpoint in a given initial dose subgroup, the median cannot be calculated and it is reported as not applicable.
measure.population: Analysis set is spontaneous bleed episodes treated with any initial dose, excluding bleed episodes treated with more than one dose for which > 24 hours between the 1st and 2nd dose was reported (bleed episodes with > 24 hours between 1st and 2nd rFVIIa dose likely reflects treatment of re-bleeding or prophylactic/maintenance dosing)

measurement_list.measurement: Using Kaplan-Meier methods to calculate the median time to event takes into account the censoring of data at the upper part of the distribution. If the upper limit falls to the right of the censoring time, then it will be missing
Since 50% or less of bleeds achieved the endpoint in the intermediate dose subgroup, the median cannot be calculated and it is reported as "not applicable" (NA)

outcome.title: Childrens' Health Related Quality of Life (Haemo-QoL): Overall Score
outcome.description: The Haemo-QoL is a specific multidimensional validated and reliable questionnaire used to assess quality of life in patients with haemophilia. Scores are reported on a 0 to 100 scale—higher scores indicate more impairment.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline (week 0) and and registry discontinuation (up to 28 months)
outcome.population: A subset of paediatric subjects age 4 to 16 (inclusive) included in the study that completed the questionnaire at baseline and/or at discontinuation

group.title: Activated Recombinant Human Factor VII
group.description: Male patients above 2 years of age with haemophilia A or B who have developed inhibitors and have been prescribed on-demand treatment of activated recombinant human factor VII at any dose for treatment of mild to moderate spontaneous bleeds

measure.title: Childrens' Health Related Quality of Life (Haemo-QoL): Overall Score
measure.description: The Haemo-QoL is a specific multidimensional validated and reliable questionnaire used to assess quality of life in patients with haemophilia. Scores are reported on a 0 to 100 scale—higher scores indicate more impairment.
measure.population: A subset of paediatric subjects age 4 to 16 (inclusive) included in the study that completed the questionnaire at baseline and/or at discontinuation

outcome.title: Adults' Health Related Quality of Life (Haemo-QoL-A): Overall Score
outcome.description: The adult Haemo-QoL-A is a specific multidimensional validated and reliable questionnaire used to assess quality of life in patients with haemophilia. Scores are reported on a 0 to 100 scale—higher scores indicate more impairment.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline (week 0) and and registry discontinuation (up to 28 months)
outcome.population: A subset of adult subjects above 16 years included in the study that completed the questionnaire at baseline and/or at discontinuation

group.title: Activated Recombinant Human Factor VII
group.description: Male patients above 2 years of age with haemophilia A or B who have developed inhibitors and have been prescribed on-demand treatment of activated recombinant human factor VII at any dose for treatment of mild to moderate spontaneous bleeds

measure.title: Adults' Health Related Quality of Life (Haemo-QoL-A): Overall Score
measure.description: The adult Haemo-QoL-A is a specific multidimensional validated and reliable questionnaire used to assess quality of life in patients with haemophilia. Scores are reported on a 0 to 100 scale—higher scores indicate more impairment.
measure.population: A subset of adult subjects above 16 years included in the study that completed the questionnaire at baseline and/or at discontinuation

outcome.title: Percentage of Bleed Treatments Resulting in Effective Haemostasis (Cessation of Bleed) by Dose Level (All Bleed Episodes)
outcome.description: Percentage of bleeds with effective haemostasis within 9 hours of first injection of activated recombinant human factor VII. Patient reported assessments were sorted into 3 sub-categories: "effective" = bleed resolved or substantially improved; "partially effective" = bleed with some improvement; "ineffective" = bleed with no change or with worsening.
outcome.population: Analysis set is all bleed episodes, regardless of bleed type or initial dose level

group.title: Activated Recombinant Human Factor VII
group.description: Male patients above 2 years of age with haemophilia A or B who have developed inhibitors and have been prescribed on-demand treatment of activated recombinant human factor VII at any dose for treatment of mild to moderate spontaneous bleeds

measure.description: Percentage of bleeds with effective haemostasis within 9 hours of first injection of activated recombinant human factor VII. Patient reported assessments were sorted into 3 sub-categories: "effective" = bleed resolved or substantially improved; "partially effective" = bleed with some improvement; "ineffective" = bleed with no change or with worsening.
measure.population: Analysis set is all bleed episodes, regardless of bleed type or initial dose level

outcome.description: Percentage of bleeds with effective haemostasis within 9 hours of first injection of activated recombinant human factor VII. Patient reported assessments were sorted into 3 sub-categories: "effective" = bleed resolved or substantially improved; "partially effective" = bleed with some improvement; "ineffective" = bleed with no change or with worsening.

outcome.title: Percentage of Bleed Treatments Resulting in Effective Pain Relief by Initial Dose (All Bleed Episodes)
outcome.description: Percentage of bleeds with effective pain relief within 9 hours of first injection of activated recombinant human factor VII. Patient reported assessments were sorted into 3 sub-categories: "Better" = pain resolved or decreased substantially; "Same" = no change; "Worsened" = pain worsening.
outcome.population: Analysis set is all bleed episodes, regardless of bleed type or initial dose level

group.description: Male patients above 2 years of age with haemophilia A or B who have developed inhibitors and have been prescribed on-demand treatment of activated recombinant human factor VII at any dose for treatment of mild to moderate spontaneous bleeds

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: If an investigator wishes to publish information from the study, a copy of the manuscript must be provided to Novo Nordisk for review at least 60 days before submission for publication or presentation. The investigator will recognize the integrity of a multi-centre study by not publishing data derived from the individual site until the combined results from the completed registry have been published in full, or the sponsor confirms there will be no multi-centre registry publication.
